intro: Pauridia occidentalis, commonly known as the western pauridia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions. Pauridia occidentalis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
